title: Gmunder Tagespost Typefaces
content:
Hi,

I’m doing this project that involves the German newspaper Gmunder Tagespost and I would like to know what typefaces they use. Here’s the examples.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007181015im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/logo_5997.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007181015im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/type1_3967.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007181015im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/type2_6284.gif)

 [‹ font similar "livinghome"](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007181015/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39436 "Go to previous forum topic") [ID font in this logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007181015/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39443 "Go to next forum topic")
author: luismrmartins

comments.content: The Bézier curves in your first sample are seriously degenerated. It may have started out as some kind of Egyptienne? I don’t know. Even so, that’s actually [what the newspaper uses for a logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007181015/http:/www.gmuender-tagespost.de/). Strange! Anyway, the second one I think is Frutiger and the last may be an Utopia...

“GMÜNDER TAGESPOST” seems to be hand-drawn. look at the different “S“.

“ES pumpt Milliarden in Galileo” and “BRÜSSEL” must be frutiger.

the copytext and introtext seem to be [utopia](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007181015/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/utopia/) (regular and semi-bold).

#1 (masthead) is custom (and quirky, omg!)  
#2 (‘EU …’) is Frutiger.  
[edit: nevermind]
Oh my god, that masthead is just rediculous.
Oh ja, dieses masthead ist relativ schlecht :)
relativ schlecht, you call it. Hehe, it’s VERY bad. :)
